lpctools.configs.title: LPCTools configs - %s
lpctools.configs.generic.title: Generic
lpctools.configs.generic.comment.configO: The key open the in-game config GUI
lpctools.configs.tools.title: Tools
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA:
Enable to list the configs for Filling Assistant
This tool helps you set blocks to fill holes automatically
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_Hotkey: The key to open/close fillingAssistant tool
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_limitP: Limit the filling speed of the filling assistant to prevent being kicked out of some servers due to excessive packet sending
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_maxBlo: Set the maximum number of blocks the filling assistant can fill per tick on average
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_reachD: If ghost blocks or ghost items often appears, you can try to decrease this value
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_testDi:
A higher value allows the Fill Assistant to search paths within a larger radius
This improves accuracy in detecting whether block placement will block the original path
but may significantly impact performance with larger values
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_disabl: Disables Filling Assistant in game when left mouse button down
Disables Filling Assistant when GUI(such as config screen, ESC screen or inventory screen) opened
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_placea: Items that can be placed as blocks by fillingAssistant
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_passab: Blocks that referred to as passage by fillingAssistant
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_transp: Let the filler assistant treat all transparent blocks as passable when pathfinding
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_notOpa:
Let the filler assistant treat all non-opaque blocks as passable when pathfinding
§8Don't ask me if this is a duplicate of the one above
§8If you ask, it's because Mojang did something weird
§8isTransparent() and !isOpaque() are not necessarily equal
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_requir:
Blocks that reserved when filling blocks
No blocks will be placed next to such block by Filling Assistant.
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_Offhan: Uses offhand to operate when enabled
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_LimitF: The maximum or minimum value limits the maximum or minimum coordinate of the block to be placed
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_OuterR: Refer to outer range blocks as unpassable, passable or origin
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.FA_ValueC: Select a value to be changed using the hotkey below
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC:
Enable to list the configs for LiquidCleaner
This tool helps you set blocks to clean liquid automatically
Needs a lot of water-undestroyable water-unloggable non plant zero hardness blocks
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_Hotkey: The key to open/close liquidCleaner tool
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_limitI: Limit the interact speed of the liquid cleaner to prevent being kicked out of some servers due to excessive packet sending
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_maxBlo: Set the maximum number of blocks the liquid cleaner can fill or set (sum up) per tick on average
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_reachD: If ghost blocks or ghost items often appears, you can try to decrease this value
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_disabl: Disables Liquid Cleaner when GUI(such as config screen, ESC screen or inventory screen) opened
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_Offhan: Uses offhand to operate when enabled
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_BlockB:
Blocks excluded from being used by the fluid cleanup tool
For example, you can enter 'minecraft:slime_block'
This will restrict fluid cleanup to only use blocks like honey blocks or resin blocks
Prevents accidental damage to your TNT flying machines
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_LimitC:
Limits cleaning range based on miniHUD shapes
(so that you should install miniHUD to enable this config)
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_RangeN:
Only regions with specific naming prefixes will be processed.
Default prefix: "LC", then valid formats include:
"+LC","-LC","+~LC","-~LC"
Symbol semantics explained in "Region Operation Mode" below.
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_RangeL:
Treat Litematica's render range as a special region for calculation.
Processing priority: After all Litematica schematics, but before other MiniHUD regions.
lpctools.configs.tools.comment.LC_Render:
Four operation modes for schematic render ranges:
"+": Add shape to allowed area (Union)
"-": Subtract shape from allowed area (Difference)
"+": Add area outside shape (Inverse Union)
"-": Keep only overlapping area (Intersection)
